FuncDef:
The ccm tlv sender-id command enables continuity check messages (CCMs) to be sent to carry the Sender ID TLV field.
The undo ccm tlv sender-id command disables CCMs to be sent from carrying the Sender ID TLV field.
By default, CCMs to be sent do not carry the Sender ID TLV field.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In CFM scenarios, to enable CCMs to be sent to carry the Sender ID TLV field, run the ccm tlv sender-id command. The local device's identifier information (chassis ID and management address) is encapsulated in a CCM's Sender ID TLV field and sent to the peer device, and the peer device can parse the identifier information as required.
Precautions
The function to carry Sender ID TLVs in CCMs is effective only for boards of the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S/LPUI-51-CM/LPUF-120/LPUF-120-B/LPUF-120-E/LPUI-102-E/LPUI-120/LPUI-120-B/LPUI-120-L/LPUI-52-E/LPUI-120-E/LPUI-120-CM/LPUF-240/LPUF-240-B/LPUF-240-E/LPUI-240/LPUI-240-B/LPUI-240-CM/LPUI-240-L/LPUF-480/LPUF-480-B/LPUI-480/LPUI-480-B/LPUI-480-L/LPUF-480-E/LPUI-480-CM/LPUF-400-E type.
The function to carry Sender ID TLVs in CCMs is effective only for boards of the LPUI-200/LPUI-200-L/LPUF-200/LPUF-200-B/LPUI-1T/LPUI-1T-B/LPUI-1T-L/LPUI-1T-CM/LPUI-241/LPUI-241-B/LPUI-241-CM/LPUF-241/LPUF-241-E/LPUI-480-CM/LPUF-52 type.
